page.title: 12Halston Hall Whittington
page.content: Most of{Halston Estate}was built in 1848.The oldest part is the Hall,which was built in 1690.The roof has been changed three times since.In 1160 there was a village where the Hall now stands.The estate has been owned by {John Mytton,Mr.Wright,Mr.Swann,and the {Eccles family.}It is now owned by {Major J.Harvey.}Inside the Hall there is a silver chalice made in 1667.There are 27 bells in the house for calling the servants.A former owner{John {Mytton}was called{Mad Jack}because he did mad things.He kept a bear in the cellar,he rode a horse upstairs and he once set himself alight to stop his hiccups.He tried jumping a fence with a horse and cart.He pretended to be a highwayman and stopped a coach and robbed it.Mad Jack died in prison.
